metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1649 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Program::getUniformInternal function in Program.cpp in libANGLE, asused in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.108, does not properly handle acertain data-type mismatch, which allows remote attackers to cause a denialof service (buffer overflow) or possibly have unspecified other impact viacrafted shader stages.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1649` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1113
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1113
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1113
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1113
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1113
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1113').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.7-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
